definition: the Righteous and Harmonious Fists/the Boxers (history)
justice/righteousness/meaning/foster (father etc)/adopted/artificial (tooth, limb etc)/relationship/friendship
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy
and/together with/with/sum/union/peace/harmony/Taiwan pr. [han4] when it means "and" or "with"
surname He/Japanese (food, clothes etc)
to combine a powdery substance (flour, plaster etc) with water/Taiwan pr. [huo4]
to complete a set in mahjong or playing cards
to compose a poem in reply (to sb's poem) using the same rhyme sequence/to join in the singing/to chime in with others
to mix (ingredients) together/to blend/classifier for rinses of clothes/classifier for boilings of medicinal herbs
round/lump/ball/to roll into a ball/to gather/regiment/group/society/classifier for a lump or a soft mass: wad (of paper), ball (of wool), cloud (of smoke)
Boxer Rebellion

sentences.english: The incident of Yihetuan (anti-imperialist organization at the end of 19th century) is historical, but also modern.
sentences.chinese: 義和團事件是歷史的，也是現代的。

sentences.english: The Boxer Band tunes in to historyThe Boxers’ negative image in the West is of little concern.
sentences.chinese: 當地毫不在意義和團在西方人眼中的負面形象。

sentences.english: The Boxer episode is commonly portrayed in the West as an orgy of anti-foreign violence.
sentences.chinese: 在西方，義和團被視作反西方的暴力狂歡。

sentences.english: Mao Zedong's Red Guards sometimes called themselves “new Boxers”.
sentences.chinese: 紅衛兵有時自稱“新義和團”。

sentences.english: During the uprising, the Plum Flower Boxers renamed themselves the “Righteous and Harmonious Fists”.
sentences.chinese: 在義和團運動中，梅花拳更名爲“義和拳”。

sentences.english: Ever since the uprising, memories of it have troubled the relationship between China and the West.
sentences.chinese: 對義和團運動的歷史記憶一直困擾着中西關係。

sentences.english: Trigram of Taoism doctrine had been largely used in the Boxers' notices.
sentences.chinese: 道教教義中的八卦在義和團揭帖中多有使用。

sentences.english: The Boxer Rebellion has an important influence on the sea transportation of tribute grain in the Late Qing Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 義和團運動對晚清的漕糧運輸產生了重大影響。

sentences.english: In summer 1900, China was convulsed by Boxer attacks on these groups.
sentences.chinese: 在1900年夏，義和團的抵抗運動震撼了中國。

sentences.english: A second series of destruction followed when eight allied armies put down the Boxer Movement in 1900.
sentences.chinese: 第二次浩劫是1900年的八國聯軍鎮壓義和團運動。

sentences.english: Mao Zedong’s Red Guards sometimes called themselves “new Boxers”.
sentences.chinese: 紅衛兵有時自稱“新義和團”。

definition: White Lotus society
Self-Strengthening Movement (period of reforms in China c 1861-1894), also named 自強運動|自强运动
to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
national prestige
foreign affairs (in Qing times)/foreign learning
Lelang commandery (108 BC-313 AD), one of four Han dynasty commanderies in north Korea
commander-in-chief, the equivalent of king in Chinese chess
to exhort (sb) to live a virtuous life (Buddhism)/to beg for alms
May Fourth Movement/Chinese national renewal movement that started with 4th May 1919 protest against the Treaty of Versailles
disaster of war
variant of 授予[shou4 yu3]
to sacrifice oneself in a just cause/a victim of a disaster
Fabi, first currency issued by the 國民黨|国民党[Guo2 min2 dang3] in 1935, in use until 1948
The Jesuits (Society of Jesus)
sb who sacrifices himself/sacrificial victim/sb who is expendable
state religion
